results.p: Clone a GitHub repository locally. Pass additional git clone flags by listing them after -- . If the OWNER/ portion of the OWNER/REPO repository argument is ...
You can clone a repository from GitHub.com to your local computer, or to a codespace, to make it easier to fix merge conflicts, add or remove files, ...
gh repo clone. This is one of the commands GitHub cli comes with. The gh clone works in a similar way as the popular git command, git clone.
You can pass the git parameters to the gh command: gh repo clone <repository> [<directory>] [-- <gitflags>...] E.g: gh repo clone <repo> ...
results.t: Clone specific repository branch with GitHub CLI

results.p: If I already forked a repo with the GH UI should I be using gh repo fork REPOSITORY --clone=true or just git clone MYREPO?
results.t: Quick question gh --clone or git clone? : r/git

results.p: Clone a GitHub repository locally. If the "OWNER/" portion of the "OWNER/REPO" repository argument is omitted, it defaults to the name of the authenticating ...
Try the command without sudo : gh repo clone (username)/(repo-name). If login is successfully done, this should work.
